jsx.event
Class Events

java.lang.Object
  js.Disposable
      jsx.event.Events

public final class Events
extends Disposable

A utility class with its static methods providing facilities to access DOM events related information eliminating browser dependencies.

Author:
J.J.Liu (Jianjun Liu) at http://www.jscripter.org

Method Summary

Method Detail

copyEvent

public static final JsEvent copyEvent(JsEvent e)

Returns a copy of a browser event object.

Parameters:
e - The original browser event object.
Returns:
A copy of the event object for IE or the event object itself for other browsers.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
Nodes.copy

fireEvent

public static final void fireEvent(JsElement elm,
                                   JsEvent evt)

Dispatches a browser event object.

Parameters:
elm - The element to fire a browser event.
evt - The browser event being dispatched from the element.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
JsElement.fireEvent(JsEvent), JsElement.dispatchEvent(JsEvent)

srcElement

Parameters:
e - A browser event object.
Returns:
The HTML element related.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
JsEvent.srcElement, JsEvent.target

setCapture

public static final void setCapture(JsNode o)

Sets the mouse capture to the object belonging to the current document if relevant.

Note that this method is browser-independent in that it simply calls JsNode.setCapture() at the given node object on IE browsers or does nothing on others.

Parameters:
o - A node object.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
JsNode.setCapture()

releaseCapture

public static final void releaseCapture(JsNode o)

Removes mouse capture from the object in the current document if relevant.

Note that this method is browser-independent in that it simply calls JsNode.setCapture() at the given node object on IE browsers or does nothing on others.

Parameters:
o - A node object.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
JsNode.releaseCapture()

fromLeftButton

public static final boolean fromLeftButton(JsEvent e)

Determines whether a browser event comes from the left mouse button, eliminating the browser dependencies.

Parameters:
e - A browser event.
Returns:
true if the event was fired by the left mouse button; false, otherwise.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
JsMouseEvent.button

stopPropagation

public static final void stopPropagation(JsEvent e)

Stops a browser event from propagating any further through the capturing, target, or bubbling phases of event propagation.

This method simply set JsEvent.cancelBubble of the event object to true on IE or calls JsEvent.stopPropagation() at the event object on other web browsers.

Parameters:
e - A browser event.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
preventDefault(JsEvent), stop(JsEvent), JsEvent.stopPropagation(), JsEvent.cancelBubble

preventDefault

public static final void preventDefault(JsEvent e)

Tells the web browser not to perform the default action associated with the given event, if there is one.

This method simply set JsEvent.returnValue of the event object to false on IE or calls JsEvent.preventDefault() at the event object on other web browsers.

Parameters:
e - A browser event.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
stopPropagation(JsEvent), stop(JsEvent), JsEvent.preventDefault(), JsEvent.returnValue

stop

public static final void stop(JsEvent e)

Stops a browser event from propagating any further through the capturing, target, or bubbling phases of event propagation and tells the web browser not to perform the default action associated with the given event, if there is one.

This method simply calls the stopPropagation(JsEvent) and preventDefault(JsEvent) methods with the same browser event object.

Parameters:
e - A browser event.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
preventDefault(JsEvent), stopPropagation(JsEvent), JsEvent.stopPropagation(), JsEvent.cancelBubble
